question: What % of custom duty is imposed on cars below 800cc?

 "(i)         The FOB value of a motor vehicle at the time of its manufacture, as 
certified by the manufacturers or their authorized local agents shall be 
accepted.  
 
(ii)        In case of domestic models, for which the FOB values are not 
provided by the manufacturers, the FOB values certified by the 
manufacturers or their authorized agents in case of export models of 
similar vehicles shall be loaded by 5% on the C&F value.  
 
(iii)  The local agent's commission and other incidental charges, if any, shall 
be added to the so ascertained FOB value, if not already included in the 
price certified by the manufacturers or their authorized local agents.  
 
(iv)        The actual amount of ocean/ air fr eight as calculated from the country 
of original manufacture shall be added for the purpose of arriving at 
the C&F value of the imported vehicle.  
 
(v)        Actual amount of insurance in the country of manufacture or first"]
ground_truth: The customer duty on automotive vehicles of Asian makes meant for transport of persons of up to 800cc is US$ 4800

question: What benefits can disabled people get on importing cars?
answer: Disabled people can import a new car with an engine capacity not exceeding 1,350 cc for personal use without paying customs duties once every five years, provided they meet certain eligibility criteria and conditions outlined in government notifications. These conditions include having a physical disability (excluding mental disabilities), being able to drive the car with the help of special gadgets, holding a valid driving license, and having a monthly income between Rs. 20,000 and Rs. 100,000. The car must be brand new, bear a special registration number, and display special color plates indicating it is for disabled persons. The car cannot be sold, transferred, or otherwise disposed of within five years of import, except in specific circumstances as outlined in the notification.

ground_truth: (i) PTA shall provide online application service whereby web-based user interface https://dirbs.pta.gov.pk/drs/auth/login utility can be accessed by international travelers for hassle free registration and payment of duty/taxes against mobile devices imported in accompanied baggage. This utility may also be accessed through Franchise of the Cellular Mobile Operators; [For registration the international traveler can also access DIRBS by dialing Unstructured Supplementary Service Data (USSD) Code *8484# from any mobile phone having a local SIM.](ii) The aforesaid utility will guide the applicant about the information required to be submitted for online registration of mobile devices. The system in particular will require the applicant/traveler to submit the details of passport number, Computerized national Identity Card (CNIC) number, International Motile Equipment Identity (IMEI) number etc.;(iii) 1[The above-mentioned information submitted by applicant will be auto processed/validated through WeBOC. The mobile devices will accordingly be cleared by the system in accordance with applicable rates of duty and taxes.(iv) The system shall electronically generate Payment Slip ID (PSID) for payment of duty/taxes. The applicant will then have options to pay the leviable duty/taxes through online banking, ATM, mobile banking, and bank branches of all leading.

question: What benefits can disabled people get on importing cars in Pakistan
answer: Under the Disabled Persons Scheme in Pakistan, disabled individuals who meet certain eligibility criteria can import a new car without paying customs duties once every five years. To qualify, the individual must have a physical disability (excluding mental disabilities or old age disabilities), possess a valid driving license, have a monthly income between PKR 20,000 and PKR 100,000, and be deemed fit to drive a car after installing necessary gadgets. The car must be brand new, and it cannot be used for commercial purposes. The car must also display a special registration number and color plates indicating that it belongs to a disabled person. The authorization for importing the car is valid for one year, and alterations or transfers without approval are not permitted. The sale, transfer, or alienation of the car is also prohibited during the initial five years of ownership. This benefit is separate from the federal government's concessions and exemptions on importing specific types of old and used automotive vehicles.

ground_truth: A disable person is allowed exemption of customs duty on import of new motor car of engine capacity not exceeding 1350cc, fitted with special gadgets for the purpose of compensating disability, for his own use subject to the following conditions and procedures namely:-(i) Only those disabled persons shall be entitled to import the customized cars who have been issued an import authorization certificate by the Ministry of Commerce as per criteria and conditions laid down in the Notification No. 6(I)/2009-Import-III, dated 01.09.2010, issued by the Ministry of Commerce (https://www.commerce.gov.pk/wp-content/uploads/pdf/SRO_61_2009_new.pdf);(iii) Only one car shall be allowed to be imported by a disabled person in terms of this notification.(iv) The car shall not be sold or otherwise transferred to any person before the expiry of five years from the date of its arrival in Pakistan, except under certain conditions mentioned in the aforesaid notification.

question: What is the procedure of temporary registration of phones for foreign nationals?
answer: The procedure for temporary registration of phones for foreign nationals involves providing credentials such as passport number, date of arrival, intended date of departure, and mobile SIM issued in their name, as well as the IMEI(s) of the device, through the web-based registration facility available at the link https://dirbs.pta.gov.pk/drs. The system will validate and verify the entered mobile number from mobile operators and cross-check the date of arrival from the FIA Integrated Border Management System (IBMS). If the checks are successful, the system will electronically generate a PSID for payment of duty/taxes and prescribed fine, which can be paid through various methods. Once payment is confirmed, the mobile device will be whitelisted in DIRBS. Travelers can also register their mobile devices brought-in accompanied baggage within 60 days of arrival. For overseas Pakistanis/foreigners visiting Pakistan on short-term visits, this temporary registration facilitation module will apply to only one mobile device, and they must provide their credentials and IMEI(s) through the web-based registration facility. For locally traded un-registered mobile devices, the holder/proprietor must declare them at the nearest Collectorate of Customs, provide soft copy of IMEI details in excel format, and obtain a CoC from the PTA after processing the application. The Customs authorities will then release the device upon issuance of the CoC.

(ii)  On receipt of declaration, the designated Customs official shall verify the particulars and endorse the stamp on the declaration form and detain the mobile device. (iii)  Thereafter, the holder shall file an application supported with duly stamped declaration form before PTA for issuance of CoC along with soft form excel sheet containing IMEI of device(s).  The PTA shall process the application in accordance with their SoP and accordingly issue CoC. (iv)  Upon issuance of CoC, the applicant shall approach the Customs authorities for release of the mobile device. The Customs']
ground_truth: The following mechanism shall be followed for temporary registration of mobile devices in use of overseas Pakistanis/ Foreigners (including those working abroad or Pakistani students studying aboard) visiting Pakistan on short term visits through web-based registration available at link https://dirbs.pta.gov.pk/drs(i) This temporary /registration facilitation module for overseas Pakistanis/ Foreigners will be applicable for only one (1) mobile handset device.(ii) To avail this facility, the applicant shall provide his/her credentials including passport No., date of arrival and intended date of departure, mobile SIM issued in his/her name, IMEI(s) of the device.(iii) The system shall carry out validation/verification on real time basis for the entered mobile number from mobile operators to validate/verify that the said SIM has been issued in the name of the applicant only. In case of non-validation/non-verification, the application will not be processed any further.(iv) The system shall carry out real time validation from FIA Integrated Border Management System (IBMS) to verify the date of arrival of applicant. In case of non-validation/non-verification, the application shall not be processed any further.(v) Upon these validations/verifications from FIA and Mobile Operators, the application shall be processed, and the applied IMEI(s) will be paired with the applied mobile number. This will allow mobile service with the declared SIM/mobile number only and in case of insertion of any other SIM, the device shall not allow any network connectivity.(vi) An IMEI which has been applied once for this facility if applied again by using another person's passport, the same IMEI shall not be allowed this facility and will require the device to be registered as per prevailing procedures of payment of applicable duty and taxes.(vii) On lapse of 120 days, the IMEI(s) utilized under this facility shall be blacklisted and shall not be allowed local network services.(viii) In case, the same applicant visits Pakistan again, he/she will be required to re-apply for this temporary facility with the same credentials which were used for the 1St or previous registration under this scheme. Furthermore, all above stated checks will be re-verified from FIA and Mobile operators for the said temporary registration.

question: What is the custom duty on products imported from China?
answer: The customs duty on products imported from China depends on various factors such as the type of product, its classification under the PCT system, and the specific duties and taxes applicable at the time and place of importation. The exact rate of duty can be determined by consulting the relevant customs schedules and rules, as outlined in documents such as THE CUSTOMS ACT 1969 and the Fifth Schedule-23-24. Some products may be eligible for exemptions or concessions, while others may be subject to standard rates of duty. It is recommended to consult a customs expert or regulatory authority for specific guidance on customs duty calculations for imports from China.

ground_truth: For the purpose of implementing Rule 8(b) of the China-Pakistan FTA Rules of Origin, where transportation is affected through the territory outside the two member states, the following shall be produced to the Government authorities of the importing Member State:(a) A through Bill of Lading issued in the exporting Member State.(b) A Certificate of Origin issued by the relevant Government authorities of the exporting Member State.(d) A copy of the original commercial invoice in respect of the product: and(e) Supporting documents in evidence that the requirements of Rule 8(b) sub-paragraphs (i), (ii) and (iii) of the China-Pakistan FTA Rules ofOrigin are being complied with.
